name: Bodyweight Walking Lunge

instructions.description: Stand upright with feet hip-width apart, arms relaxed at your sides or hands on hips.
Step forward with your right leg, lowering your body until both knees are bent at approximately 90 degrees.
Keep your torso upright, core engaged, and front knee aligned over the toes.
Push through the front heel to bring the back leg forward into the next lunge step.
Continue alternating steps in a smooth, continuous motion for the desired distance or time.

performanceMetrics.notes: Sustained movement for longer durations improves endurance.
Track total distance covered to measure progression.
Higher step counts emphasize muscular endurance.
Maintain a moderate to elevated heart rate throughout the set.
Aim for rhythmic, controlled breathing during continuous movement.

commentsNotes: Keep steps controlled rather than rushing to reduce joint strain.
Maintain upright posture to avoid excessive forward lean.
Shorten stride if knee discomfort occurs.
Can be integrated into circuits or long-distance conditioning workouts.
